programme.desc: Accusations fly at the hospital, and Ste must be a pillar of support for his son. Elsewhere, a chilling threat stops a resident in their tracks.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Misbah anxiously awaits updates on Donny, while Diane feels shattered when she discovers the truth. With tensions building, Darren jumps to conclusions, and a shocking ultimatum is made.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Greek at the Harbor: Gordon Ramsay helps a family-run Greek restaurant turn its fortunes around in Ventura Harbor in California. But he uncovers a shocking family secret.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Opposites A-Frack: Lisa calls on politician Maxine Lombard to stop Mr Burns' secret fracking operation but is taken aback when Lombard and Burns are attracted to each other.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpsorama: In a crossover episode, the Simpsons meet the Planet Express crew from Futurama, who've travelled through time to present-day Springfield to stop a catastrophe.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Platonic Permutation: At Thanksgiving, Sheldon and Amy hang out as friends at the aquarium, and Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at a soup kitchen.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Earworm Reverberation: Sheldon is driven to distraction when he can't get a familiar tune out of his head. Howard and Raj find out that their band has a fan.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Ju-Jitsu, Bubble Wrap, and Yoo-Hoo: When Sheldon is bullied by an unlikely character, Mary and George disagree about how to handle the situation.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Mother, a Child, and a Blue Man's Backside: When Mary bans Sheldon from reading a comic book, he decides it's time to stop living under his mother's thumb.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: The couples prepare for the Final Vows, where they must decide whether to continue their relationships on the outside.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Apology Insufficiency: Leonard thinks his dating problems are due to a lack of confidence, and vows to be self-assured around attractive women. Howard is called by the FBI.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The 21-Second Excitation: The gang's plans to attend a film screening are scuppered by Sheldon's nemesis Wil Wheaton. Penny and Bernadette invite Amy to her first slumber party.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Boyfriend Complexity: When Penny's father visits, Leonard discovers that her parents still think that he and Penny are a couple, so he takes advantage of the situation.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Research Study and Czechoslovakian Wedding Pastries: Dr Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins, but Mary is unhappy.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Seven Deadly Sins and a Small Carl Sagan: Mary clashes with Sheldon's drama teacher Mr Lundy over plans for a Halloween haunted house fundraiser for the church.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Planes, Trains & Cars: The Dunphys want a new car and Phil makes a spontaneous purchase without Claire. Jay is determined to sort his high school reunion with Gloria and Manny.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Disneyland: Nothing is more quintessential to good old family fun than a trip to Disneyland - but not without a side of motion sickness, achy feet and a wayward toddler.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Peeping Mom: Bart lies to cover up his role in a bulldozer crash, so Marge decides to follow him everywhere until he confesses. Ned gets a cute new dog.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Kids Are All Fight: When Homer finds an old roll of film and has it developed, the family take a trip down memory lane to when Bart and Lisa were always fighting.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wildebeest Implementation: Raj attempts to overcome his anxiety about talking to women, while Penny uses Bernadette to spy on Leonard and his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Engagement Reaction: Howard finally tells his mother that he's engaged to Bernadette. Unfortunately, the news lands his mum in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Roommate Transmogrification: Raj decides to move in with Sheldon after hearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Old Yeller Belly: Santa's Little Helper becomes Duff Beer's new mascot after he's banished from the Simpson home for failing to save Homer from a tree house fire.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Jez is running out of time as his secrets teeter on the edge of exposure. One resident is forced into a corner and makes a shocking confession, while Nancy reveals a devastating decision.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: After nearly three months, the experiment concludes with the Final Vows, as our remaining couples make the ultimate choice.

programme.title: New: The Honesty Box
programme.desc: Brand new series: Some harmless fun among the girls has far-reaching consequences. A newbie tests an existing relationship. And one couple crumble, leaving the entire group reeling. (Ep5/9)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The shows this time include American Murder: The Family Next Door, Simply Nigella, Top Gear, The Yorkshire Vet, The Savoy, and BBC News on Trump and Covid.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: (1998) Michael Bay's star-studded disaster movie starring Bruce Willis. The world's greatest drillers are sent into space to nuke a huge asteroid that's hurtling towards Earth.

programme.title: The Fits
programme.desc: (2015) Creepy horror. A young girl is fascinated by the dance troupe at her local community centre. But just as she gains access to their world, they're stricken with a mysterious illness.

programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia
programme.desc: (1962) David Lean's Oscar-winning epic. Peter O'Toole stars as TE Lawrence - the charismatic officer who united feuding Arab tribes to fight the Turks in WWI.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: (1997) Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet star in James Cameron's Oscar-winning epic. Lovers from across the social divide meet on the maiden voyage of the doomed luxury liner.

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: (1985) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. To free his kidnapped daughter, an ex US commando must agree to assassinate a South American president. But he's not as pliant as he seems...

programme.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
programme.desc: (2018) Crime thriller with Jeff Bridges, Jon Hamm, Dakota Johnson and Chris Hemsworth. A group of shifty strangers collide in a deserted motel that has its own buried secrets.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: (2011) Naughty kids are one thing but a naughty teacher? Can titular educator Cameron Diaz win a big-bucks teaching competition... and buy surgical enhancements to seduce Justin Timberlake?

programme.title: Reach for the Sky

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: Films for VE Day. (1968) Epic WWII drama with Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: (1996) Blockbusting landmark sci-fi action-thriller starring Will Smith and Jeff Goldblum. A US Air Force pilot and a scientist battle aliens who are spectacularly destroying our planet.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: (2016) Action-comedy with Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart. Two former school buddies team up to thwart a terrorist plot. But things may not be as they seem. With Amy Ryan and Jason Bateman.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: (2022) Going-for-gold action. Tom Holland and Mark Wahlberg compare abs as they scour the globe for an olde explorer's lost gold. The heat is on. The time is right. Only the best survive.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: American Woman
programme.desc: (2018) Emotional drama starring Sienna Miller. A woman must raise her grandson after her daughter disappears. With Christina Hendricks and Aaron Paul.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: (1959) Western. Randolph Scott plays a bounty hunter who has unfinished business with the brother of his latest target. But his quest for revenge looks like it could be undermined.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.desc: Anton: PE teacher Anton is going to be given five menus, each of which has been put together by a potential blind date - who will he want to see for a date... and maybe seconds?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the third and final day of the latest tournament of the season, which comes from Jack Nicklaus Golf Club in Incheon, South Korea

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at the Bombay Sapphire distillery to find out how exotic botanicals from around the world are used to flavour this classic British gin, then discover how the ingenious design of the Ghillie kettle lets owners efficiently boil water whilst exploring the great outdoors

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef goes behind the scenes of Dumfries House in Ayrshire, where he finds out about the structure and scale of the Queen Elizabeth walled garden. He also hears how King Charles's passion for sustainability is being passed on to a new generation

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Singer Matt Goss joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Jose Pizarro and Levi Roots provide the food and there are gardening tips from David Domoney

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie and radio presenter Toby Tarrant try belly dancing, while hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms the style of a charity founder

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan has a chat on the farm with actor Larry Lamb, TV screenwriter Lynda La Plante and presenter Kirsty Gallacher. Camilla Bassett-Smith demonstrates how to plant vegetables, there's a catch-up with shepherdess Susie Parish's litter of border collie pups and Jonathan Phang introduces the guests to the best of British drinks

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: David Domoney shares plant support ideas and Tayshan Hayden-Smith explores a Welsh community garden led by a rugby team. Camilla Bassett-Smith tours a renowned garden in Hampshire

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Pastry chef Ravneet Gill joins Prue to make chocolate roulade and talk about her work with Counter Talk, an organisation dedicated to improving the treatment of staff in professional kitchens. Prue dishes up a savoury twist on the classic tarte tatin, and John is in his happy place working at a local dairy

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the 1,000 Guineas from Newmarket, plus racing from Salisbury and Hamilton. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reporting by Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring Check It Out and a very silly Hair or No Hair. Plus, the launch of new mini-game show Romance or Showmance and In for a Penny, In for a Grand sees someone win a thousand pounds

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Lance Ellington, Beth Tweddle, Bob Champion and Sally Lindsay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: There are 16 players left in the ITV's light-hearted answer to Squid Game. To avoid being eliminated, they must balance on a seesaw, lick lollipops until they are small enough to fit inside a bottle, compete in a race inside a sleeping bag and pack up a pop-up tent as fast as they can

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, with Mark Chapman, Asim Chaudhry and Sue Cleaver all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: When psychiatric registrar James Ford finds himself torn between a new mother attending a routine postnatal check-up and the sectioning of a psychotic woman during a busy on-call shift, no-one can predict the terrible consequences. The MIU are brought in to investigate, but digging deeper into the events that night leads to questions about Dr Ford and his hospital department. Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Singer Jade Thirlwall faces the grilling of a lifetime from an audience of autistic and learning-disabled interviewers. Does she regret selling her soul? Were the pyramids created by aliens? Does she get trapped wind? No question or line of enquiry is off the table. Expect revelation, chaos and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Malpractice

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club

A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: Detectives spend months piecing together the scale of Luke D'Wit's deception and cruelty after officers seize a huge stash of prescription drugs from his home, including those that were found in the Baxter's systems in the postmortem. Ellena Baxter comes to terms with the truth about her family friend

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe tries to bribe Clemmie, Billy is furious, and Ryan is taken aback

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Walshes reach northern Thailand, where Barney arranges for him and Bradley to see the jungle on a rollercoaster. Then they visit a market to try the infamous durian - known as the smelliest fruit in the world - before their journey takes them into the hills where they race on wooden go-karts. The next day sees the pair face their biggest challenge - climbing into an ominous cavern named the Anxiety State Crisis Cave - before ending their trip in a temple where they reminisce about their adventures

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: Alison meets the most unlikely stray to be wandering the London streets in the form of a rare Romanian mioritic shepherd who has a fear of stairs and doorways. She also helps a tiny Bichon control its bark, and there is organised chaos when a van with seven Belgian shepherd cross puppies arrives from the RSPCA

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: The MIU turns the spotlight on Dr Hernandez and the obstetric department in the wake of Maria Carter's evidence, but the team suspects wider cultural issues when the hospital's trust question the investigation. Meanwhile, a rattled Ford unravels when he discovers new information and leaves Kate concerned with his behaviour, and a shocking secret risks exposing the doctor's lies

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Singer Jade Thirlwall faces the grilling of a lifetime from an audience of autistic and learning-disabled interviewers. Does she regret selling her soul? Were the pyramids created by aliens? Does she get trapped wind? No question or line of enquiry is off the table. Expect revelation, chaos and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: The actor embarks on an epic journey to explore the ocean's islands, beginning with tropical jungles and grassland savannah off the western coast of Africa. He encounters giant snails and helps rescue endangered sea turtles in equatorial Sao Tome and Principe, which is also known as the African Galapagos. He then treks through savannah on the remote Bijagos Islands off Guinea Bissau to meet ferocious predators and a tribe in which the women hold the power

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the final day of the regular season in the Football League, including Burnley v Millwall, Sheffield United v Blackburn Rovers and Plymouth Argyle v Leeds United in the Championship

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the third and final day of the latest tournament of the season, which comes from Jack Nicklaus Golf Club in Incheon, South Korea

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at the Bombay Sapphire distillery to find out how exotic botanicals from around the world are used to flavour this classic British gin, then discover how the ingenious design of the Ghillie kettle lets owners efficiently boil water whilst exploring the great outdoors

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef goes behind the scenes of Dumfries House in Ayrshire, where he finds out about the structure and scale of the Queen Elizabeth walled garden. He also hears how King Charles's passion for sustainability is being passed on to a new generation

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Singer Matt Goss joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Jose Pizarro and Levi Roots provide the food and there are gardening tips from David Domoney

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie and radio presenter Toby Tarrant try belly dancing, while hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms the style of a charity founder

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan has a chat on the farm with actor Larry Lamb, TV screenwriter Lynda La Plante and presenter Kirsty Gallacher. Camilla Bassett-Smith demonstrates how to plant vegetables, there's a catch-up with shepherdess Susie Parish's litter of border collie pups and Jonathan Phang introduces the guests to the best of British drinks

He encounters giant snails and helps rescue endangered sea turtles in equatorial Sao Tome and Principe, which is also known as the African Galapagos. He then treks through savannah on the remote Bijagos Islands off Guinea Bissau to meet ferocious predators and a tribe in which the women hold the power

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: LIV Golf Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the third and final day of the latest tournament of the season, which comes from Jack Nicklaus Golf Club in Incheon, South Korea

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at the Bombay Sapphire distillery to find out how exotic botanicals from around the world are used to flavour this classic British gin, then discover how the ingenious design of the Ghillie kettle lets owners efficiently boil water whilst exploring the great outdoors

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef goes behind the scenes of Dumfries House in Ayrshire, where he finds out about the structure and scale of the Queen Elizabeth walled garden. He also hears how King Charles's passion for sustainability is being passed on to a new generation

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Singer Matt Goss joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Jose Pizarro and Levi Roots provide the food and there are gardening tips from David Domoney

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie and radio presenter Toby Tarrant try belly dancing, while hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms the style of a charity founder

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan has a chat on the farm with actor Larry Lamb, TV screenwriter Lynda La Plante and presenter Kirsty Gallacher. Camilla Bassett-Smith demonstrates how to plant vegetables, there's a catch-up with shepherdess Susie Parish's litter of border collie pups and Jonathan Phang introduces the guests to the best of British drinks

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: David Domoney shares plant support ideas and Tayshan Hayden-Smith explores a Welsh community garden led by a rugby team. Camilla Bassett-Smith tours a renowned garden in Hampshire

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Pastry chef Ravneet Gill joins Prue to make chocolate roulade and talk about her work with Counter Talk, an organisation dedicated to improving the treatment of staff in professional kitchens. Prue dishes up a savoury twist on the classic tarte tatin, and John is in his happy place working at a local dairy

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the 1,000 Guineas from Newmarket, plus racing from Salisbury and Hamilton. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reporting by Matt Chapman and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring Check It Out and a very silly Hair or No Hair. Plus, the launch of new mini-game show Romance or Showmance and In for a Penny, In for a Grand sees someone win a thousand pounds

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Lance Ellington, Beth Tweddle, Bob Champion and Sally Lindsay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: There are 16 players left in the ITV's light-hearted answer to Squid Game. To avoid being eliminated, they must balance on a seesaw, lick lollipops until they are small enough to fit inside a bottle, compete in a race inside a sleeping bag and pack up a pop-up tent as fast as they can

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, with Mark Chapman, Asim Chaudhry and Sue Cleaver all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: When psychiatric registrar James Ford finds himself torn between a new mother attending a routine postnatal check-up and the sectioning of a psychotic woman during a busy on-call shift, no-one can predict the terrible consequences. The MIU are brought in to investigate, but digging deeper into the events that night leads to questions about Dr Ford and his hospital department. Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Singer Jade Thirlwall faces the grilling of a lifetime from an audience of autistic and learning-disabled interviewers. Does she regret selling her soul? Were the pyramids created by aliens? Does she get trapped wind? No question or line of enquiry is off the table. Expect revelation, chaos and a lot of laughs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.desc: The Take That star heads north with Jane McDonald as they touch down in Skukuza in the Kruger National Park. Added to the mix is a local choir, high tea, South African sparkling wine and a magical experience with a family of elephants

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Malpractice

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: Detectives spend months piecing together the scale of Luke D'Wit's deception and cruelty after officers seize a huge stash of prescription drugs from his home, including those that were found in the Baxter's systems in the postmortem. programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Walshes reach northern Thailand, where Barney arranges for him and Bradley to see the jungle on a rollercoaster. Then they visit a market to try the infamous durian - known as the smelliest fruit in the world - before their journey takes them into the hills where they race on wooden go-karts. The next day sees the pair face their biggest challenge - climbing into an ominous cavern named the Anxiety State Crisis Cave - before ending their trip in a temple where they reminisce about their adventures

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: Alison meets the most unlikely stray to be wandering the London streets in the form of a rare Romanian mioritic shepherd who has a fear of stairs and doorways. She also helps a tiny Bichon control its bark, and there is organised chaos when a van with seven Belgian shepherd cross puppies arrives from the RSPCA

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: The MIU turns the spotlight on Dr Hernandez and the obstetric department in the wake of Maria Carter's evidence, but the team suspects wider cultural issues when the hospital's trust question the investigation. Meanwhile, a rattled Ford unravels when he discovers new information and leaves Kate concerned with his behaviour, and a shocking secret risks exposing the doctor's lies

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby from London, Becca from Marlow, Sophia from Liverpool and Neil from Manchester pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe tries to bribe Clemmie, Billy is furious, and Ryan is taken aback

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Walshes reach northern Thailand, where Barney arranges for him and Bradley to see the jungle on a rollercoaster. Then they visit a market to try the infamous durian - known as the smelliest fruit in the world - before their journey takes them into the hills where they race on wooden go-karts. The next day sees the pair face their biggest challenge - climbing into an ominous cavern named the Anxiety State Crisis Cave - before ending their trip in a temple where they reminisce about their adventures

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: Alison meets the most unlikely stray to be wandering the London streets in the form of a rare Romanian mioritic shepherd who has a fear of stairs and doorways. She also helps a tiny Bichon control its bark, and there is organised chaos when a van with seven Belgian shepherd cross puppies arrives from the RSPCA

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: The MIU turns the spotlight on Dr Hernandez and the obstetric department in the wake of Maria Carter's evidence, but the team suspects wider cultural issues when the hospital's trust question the investigation. Meanwhile, a rattled Ford unravels when he discovers new information and leaves Kate concerned with his behaviour, and a shocking secret risks exposing the doctor's lies

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Singer Jade Thirlwall faces the grilling of a lifetime from an audience of autistic and learning-disabled interviewers. Does she regret selling her soul? Were the pyramids created by aliens? Does she get trapped wind? No question or line of enquiry is off the table. Expect revelation, chaos and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Martin Clunes' Islands of the Atlantic
programme.desc: The actor embarks on an epic journey to explore the ocean's islands, beginning with tropical jungles and grassland savannah off the western coast of Africa. He encounters giant snails and helps rescue endangered sea turtles in equatorial Sao Tome and Principe, which is also known as the African Galapagos. He then treks through savannah on the remote Bijagos Islands off Guinea Bissau to meet ferocious predators and a tribe in which the women hold the power

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: Dias vs Lunsford: A conservative stay-at-home wife who lets her military-minded husband run their house, swaps lives with a modern, entrepreneur mom from a same-sex relationship.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: Icgoren vs Legend: A mum of 5 who runs her house like a boot camp swaps lives with a free-spirited farmer's wife who lets her children run rampant.
